distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for curl fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-5419: TLS session resumption client cert bypass (bsc#991389)
- CVE-2016-5420: Re-using connections with wrong client cert (bsc#991390)
- CVE-2016-7141: Fixed incorrect reuse of client certificates (bsc#997420).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not prevent TLS session resumption when the client certificate has changed, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended restrictions by resuming a session.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not check the client certificate when choosing the TLS connection to reuse, which might allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl and libcurl before 7.50.2, when built with NSS and the libnsspem.so library is available at runtime, allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of a TLS connection by leveraging reuse of a previously loaded client certificate from file for a connection for which no certificate has been set, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-5420.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
